properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, overnight Wednesday through Friday. A few showers will continue today across the region with heavier rain expected to begin overnight tonight or Thursday morning and continue to Friday morning. General rainfall amounts of 30 to 50 millimetres with locally higher amounts are expected. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-13T01:09:41-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-12T17:10:41-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0660822756.2019
Area: Bruce Peninsula - Sauble Beach - Tobermory
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Alberta Emergency Alert - Wildfire Alert Updated
properties.Summary:
Description: The evacuation orders for Wabasca-Desmarais, Hamlets of Sandy Lake, and Chipewyan Lake, and all of Bigstone Cree Nation have been rescinded and the public can now return back to these areas. These areas must be prepared to evacuate on short notice, due to wildfire activity in the area. The local public must continue to monitor wildfire activity in their area by checking local websites.### The public in the MD of Opportunity must continue to monitor wildfire activity in their area. The Wabasca-Desmarais, Hamlets of Sandy Lake, and Chipewyan Lake, and all of Bigstone Cree Nation #166 A,B,C,D, can now return back to these areas. Everyone returning back to these areas remain under an evacuation alert and must be prepared to evacuate should an evacuation order be issued. Additional information is available at the MD of Opportunityâ€™s www.facebook.com/MD-of-Opportunity-No-17-Emergency-Management-1791455711074682/ Facebook Page. Additional Wildfire information is also available at www.wildfire.alberta.ca website. Check https://511.alberta.ca/#:Alerts for information on road conditions.
Expires: 2019-06-19T10:30:08-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Alberta Emergency Management Agency on behalf of the MD of Opportunity, 2019-06-12T10:29:02-06:00, NAADS-CA-AB-AEA1-5839
Area: Opportunity #17
properties.Author: Alberta Emergency Management Agency on behalf of the MD of Opportunity

properties.Title: Alberta Emergency Alert - Wildfire Alert Cancelled
properties.Summary:
Description: The emergency alert is being cancelled but there are still wildfires in the area and everyone in Peerless Trout First Nation must continue to monitor the community Facebook page and website regarding these fires. ### Peerless Trout First Nation website is www.ptfn.net and www.facebook.com/peerlesstroutfirstnation/ is the Facebook page for this community. Additional Wildfire information is also available at www.wildfire.alberta.ca website. Check https://511.alberta.ca/#:Alerts for more information on roadway information.
Expires: 2019-06-18T12:28:08-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Alberta Emergency Management Agency on behalf of Peerless Trout First Nation, 2019-06-11T12:26:25-06:00, NAADS-CA-AB-AEA1-5836
Area: Peerless Lake First Nation
properties.Author: Alberta Emergency Management Agency on behalf of Peerless Trout First Nation

properties.Title: Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory For The Northern Village Of Ile-A-La Crosse.
properties.Summary:
Description: Due to the continued upgrades at the Water Treatment Plant, a Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory remains in affect for Northern Village of Ile-a-la Crosse. This advisory is for the Northern Village of Ile-a-la Crosse and for any individuals who may access water the Ile-a-la Crosse water system. This advisory is in effect until the water is deemed completed safe.
Expires: 2019-06-18T17:00:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: SK Ile a la Crosse, 2019-06-11T09:25:40-06:00, ABCDC548-47C5-6912-D2B9-03FE44F52B74
Area: Northern Village of Ile-a-la Crosse
properties.Author: SK Ile a la Crosse

properties.Title: Alberta Emergency Alert - Wildfire Alert Cancelled
properties.Summary:
Description: The emergency alert is being cancelled but there are still wildfires in the area, and the public must keep informed regarding fire activity in their area. Go to The Dene Tha First Nation, the Mackenzie County, and the Town of High Level Facebook and website for up to date information.### More information is also available at www.facebook.com/Mackenzie-County-262409787134568/ for Mackenzie County residents. Dene Tha First Nation https://www.facebook.com/DeneThaFirstNation/ for more information. High Level https://www.facebook.com/TownofHighLevel/ for more information. Check http://511.alberta.ca/region/Northern%20Alberta#:Alerts for more road information.
Expires: 2019-06-18T16:08:09-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Alberta Emergency Management Agency On Behalf of Mackenzie County, 2019-06-11T16:07:37-06:00, NAADS-CA-AB-AEA1-5837
Area: Mackenzie #23
properties.Author: Alberta Emergency Management Agency On Behalf of Mackenzie County

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Wildfire smoke is causing locally poor air quality and reduced visibility. ### Individuals may experience symptoms such as increased coughing, throat irritation, headaches or shortness of breath. Children, seniors, and those with cardiovascular or lung disease, such as asthma, are especially at risk. People with lung diseases, such as asthma and COPD, can be particularly sensitive to air pollution. They will generally experience more serious health effects at lower levels. Pollution can aggravate their diseases, leading to increased medication use, doctor and emergency room visits, and hospital visits. For more information please visit Alberta Health Services at www.albertahealthservices.ca/news/air.aspx. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-06-13T08:37:41-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, Alberta Environment and Parks, Alberta Health, Alberta Health Services, 2019-06-12T16:38:41-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1826740926.2019
